Case: Century 21 Canada Ltd. v. Rogers Communications Inc. (Zoocasa)
Issue: Web scraping, browse-wrap terms, copyright in listings and photos
Holding: Browse-wrap terms enforceable; copyright infringement found in photos and listing data
Remedy: Permanent injunction; statutory damages ~CAD $32,000; nominal damages

Issue: Internet framing, copyright in photos, fair dealing defense
Holding: Framing constitutes 'making available' under Copyright Act; fair dealing defense rejected
Legal_Basis: Copyright Act s. 2.4(1.1) and s. 27; fair dealing s. 29

Issue: Privacy violations, republishing court decisions for profit
Holding: PIPEDA breach; republishing personal data without consent unlawful even if public record
Remedy: CAD $5,000 damages plus costs; de-indexing and erasure order
Legal_Basis: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)

Issue: Copyright in obituaries and photos; commercial scraping without consent
Holding: Authors own copyright in obituaries; commercial infringement found; statutory damages awarded
Legal_Basis: Copyright Act ss. 27, 28.1; statutory damages s. 38.1

Case: Toronto Real Estate Board v. Mongohouse
Issue: Unauthorized access to proprietary data; breach of licensing agreements
Holding: Injunction granted restraining unauthorized access and data use

Case: Google Inc. v. Equustek Solutions Inc.
Issue: Worldwide de-indexing injunction against search engine
Holding: SCC upheld worldwide injunction requiring Google to de-index infringing sites globally

Case: Keatley Surveying Ltd. v. Teranet Inc.
Issue: Crown copyright in survey plans filed in government registry
Holding: Province owns copyright in survey plans; direction/control test applied

Issue: Forum selection clause enforceability in consumer contracts; privacy rights
Holding: Forum selection clause unenforceable due to inequality of bargaining power and privacy interests
Remedy: Action allowed in home jurisdiction; clause not enforced
Legal_Basis: BC Privacy Act; Consumer protection; Contract law

Case: Dell Computer Corp. v. Union des consommateurs
Issue: Arbitration clause enforceability in electronic contracts
Holding: Arbitration clause valid; arbitration is neutral forum independent of geography

Issue: Unconscionability of arbitration clause in platform contract
Holding: Arbitration clause unconscionable and invalid due to gross inequality and unfair terms
Remedy: Clause unenforceable; class action may proceed

Issue: Copyright in crowdsourced postal code database
Holding: Case settled; no public judgment; outcome favorable to crowdsourcing advocates

Case: CanLII v. Caseway AI et al.
Issue: Bulk scraping of legal decisions; breach of ToS; copyright infringement
Holding: Litigation pending as of Nov 2025; civil claim alleges 3.5M files downloaded
Remedy: Injunction and damages sought; no determination yet
Legal_Basis: Copyright Act; Contract (breach of ToS); Terms of Service

Issue: AI training on copyrighted news content; TPM circumvention claims
Holding: Litigation ongoing; no decision as of Nov 2025
Legal_Basis: Copyright Act; TPM circumvention ss. 41-41.27; Contract breach
